member.summary: Builds the argument line in order to start DOSBox.

Whether or not we are starting the game's setup utility or the game itself.
The path to DOSBox.exe.
The .conf file to use for DOSBox.
The .lng file to use for DOSBox.

member.summary: Run DOSBox itself, without any game.
member.param: Path to DOSBox.exe.
Path to DOSBox.conf.
Path to DOSBox.lng.
member.returns: The DOSBox process if it started successfully, null otherwise.

member.summary: Starts DOSBox, and returns whether it was successful.
member.param: Path to DOSBox.exe.
Command line args passed to DOSBox.
DOSBox config file to use (optional).
member.returns: True if DOSBox started, false if it did not.

member.name: M:AmpShell.Notification.PropertyChangedNotifier.Set``1(``0@,``0,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a property already matches a desired value. Sets the property and notifies listeners only when necessary.
member.param: Reference to a property with both getter and setter..
Desired value for the property..
Name of the property used to notify listeners. This value is optional and can be provided automatically when invoked from compilers that support CallerMemberName.
member.returns: True if the value was changed, false if the existing value matched the desired value..

member.name: T:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW
member.summary: The IShellLink interface allows Shell links to be created, modified, and resolved.

member.summary: Retrieves the path and file name of a Shell link object.

member.summary: Retrieves the list of item identifiers for a Shell link object.

member.summary: Sets the pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) for a Shell link object..

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetDescription(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the description string for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetDescription(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the description for a Shell link object. The description can be any application-defined string.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetWorkingDirectory(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of the working directory for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetWorkingDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name of the working directory for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetArguments(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the command-line arguments associated with a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetArguments(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the command-line arguments for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetHotkey(System.Int16@)
member.summary: Retrieves the hot key for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetHotkey(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets a hot key for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetShowCmd(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show command for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetShowCmd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the show command for a Shell link object. The show command sets the initial show state of the window..

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.GetIconLocation(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the location (path and index) of the icon for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetIconLocation(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the location (path and index) of the icon for a Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetRelativePath(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the relative path to the Shell link object.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.Resolve(System.IntPtr,AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS)
member.summary: Attempts to find the target of a Shell link, even if it has been moved or renamed.

member.name: M:AmpShell.WinShell.IShellLinkW.SetPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the path and file name of a Shell link object.

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_SHORTPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the standard short (8.3 format) file name

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_UNCPRIORITY
member.summary: Retrieves the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path name of the file

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLGP_FLAGS.SLGP_RAWPATH
member.summary: Retrieves the raw path name. A raw path is something that might not exist and may include environment variables that need to be expanded

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, the high-order word of fFlags can be set to a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds). To specify a value, set the high word of fFlags to the desired time-out duration, in milliseconds.

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_ANY_MATCH
member.summary: Obsolete and no longer used

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

member.name: F:AmpShell.WinShell.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_INVOKE_MSI
member.summary: Call the Microsoft Windows Installer
